content: Terrestrial water storage (TWS) defined as an integrated estimate of water stored on and beneath the surface of earth. Terrestrial water storage can be defined as the summation of all water on the land surface in and subsurface. It includes surface soil moisture, root zone soil moisture, groundwater, snow, ice, water stored in the vegetation, river and lake water. Average groundwater level and groundwater level pattern in last year
